org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as

Class BaseVariableNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.SourceLocation
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.NodeBase
        • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.TreeNode
          • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.BaseDefinitionNode
            • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.BaseTypedDefinitionNode
              • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.BaseVariableNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISourceLocation, IInitializableDefinitionNode, IASNode, IDefinitionNode, IDocumentableDefinitionNode, ITypedNode, IVariableNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParameterNode, VariableNode

    public abstract class BaseVariableNode
extends BaseTypedDefinitionNode
implements IVariableNode, IInitializableDefinitionNode
    Base class for variables, including both traditional variables as well as arguments

      • getDeclarationEnd

        public int getDeclarationEnd()
        Description copied from interface: IVariableNode
        Get the local end offset of this variable declaration. For single variables such as var i:int = 10; getEnd() will be returned For multiple variables such as var i:int = 10, j:int = 20, k:int = 30; we create a variable node for variable 'i'. Variable 'j' and 'k' are created as chained nodes with parent as variable node 'i' So, if we call this api for 'i', then the offset where the variable 'i' declaration ends will be returned. Note that in this case, getEnd() returns the end of the entire statement. This api is different from getEnd() only when variable node contains chained variables
        Specified by:
        getDeclarationEnd in interface IVariableNode
        Returns:
        the local offset where the variable declaration ends
